p: The use of metabolic profiling as a tool for the discrimination of cultivars of several crops has been reported in the literature [ 78, 79]. Principal component analysis (PCA) and HCA techniques classified the EOs from five varieties of P. betle into three groups. Group I, which englobes “Misti” and “BARI Paan 3” varieties, presented chavicol (3.97–11.95%), ( E)-β-caryophyllene (4.24–4.69%), and valencene (3.02–3.11%). Group II was composed only of the variety “Bangla” due to the presence of eugenyl acetate (1.50%) and α-humulene (1.35%) in its composition. The varieties “Sanchi” and “Khasia” were separated in Group III, which was characterized by γ-muurolene (1.74–4.49%) and ( E)-β-caryophyllene (1.74–4.93%) in their compositions [ 80].
